TITLE.P: Natural Gas Downstream Engineering & Technical Support Services '18

SHORT_DESCR.P: The services required involve various aspects of maintenance and emergency response support, by way of sub-contracts, to Phoenix Energy Services Ltd in relation to downstream maintenance activity associated with a natural gas network in, and around, customer meter points. It is envisaged that there will be 2 categories of sub-contractors appointed:
— Category A: Principle Sub-Contractor - responsible for full-service provision and emergency support service, and,
— Category B: Miscellaneous Minor Works Sub-contractor- responsible for a lesser scope of service provision.
Category B may be required to progress to Category A capability within a specified time period but only with regards to emergency service providers.

TITLE.P: Downstream Engineering & Technical Support Services '18 - CAT A

MAIN_SITE.P: Greater Belfast, Larne, Carrickfergus and East Down.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision of Natural Gas Downstream Engineering & Technical Support Services - CAT A.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Possible 4 years extension to original Contract Term.

TITLE.P: Downstream Engineering & Technical Support Services '18 - CAT B

MAIN_SITE.P: Greater Belfast, Larne, Carrickfergus and East Down.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision of Downstream Engineering & Technical Support Services '18 - CAT B.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Possible 4 years extension to the initial Contract Term.

RULES_CRITERIA.P: Parties interested in applying for this opportunity should express their interest on e-sourcingni.bravosolution.co.uk stating which Lot that they are interested in tendering for:
— Category A: Principle Sub-Contractor with a minimum operational resource of between approximately 10 to 12 personnel, or,
— Category B: Miscellaneous Minor Works Sub-contractor - with a minimum resource level of between 1 to 2 operational personnel.
Completed PQQ’s received shall be quantifiably scored by the Contracting Authority with the top 6 scoring applicants in each Category invited to proceed to the tender stage.

Approximately 80 % of service requirements will be allocated to the Cat. A Sub-contractors of which one, or more, may be appointed. The remaining percentage of services being divided up amongst the Cat. B Sub-contractors - several appointed.
The proposed agreements will be for an initial 4 years term albeit an extension facility may increase this period up to a maximum of 8 years.

MAIN_FINANCING_CONDITION.P: Payment shall be made for services that are completed in full, and to the correct standard, within 30 days from receipt of invoice.

LEGAL_FORM.P: Applications from consortia may be considered albeit any proposed consortia must form a legal entity prior to the award of any contract - should their bid prove successful.
Each member of the consortia must be jointly and severally liable for the obligations and liabilities placed upon them through any contract awarded.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: Contract performance conditions shall be further outlined in the tender documentation which is available by expressing an interest in:

FRAMEWORK.JUSTIFICATION: The initial term of each Framework Agreement shall be four years albeit these may be extended up to a maximum term of eight years.

INFO_ADD.P: Parties interested in applying for this opportunity should, first of all, express their interest in:

N.B. whilst any award and subsequent-agreement will be with Phoenix Energy Services the Buyer Organisation referred to on the e-sourcing website will be Phoenix Natural Gas - both companies are part of the same Group.

Once their interest is registered they will then receive tender documentation - Prequalification Questionnaire (PQQ) and Invitation to Tender (ITT) document - for their perusal. Should a Party wish to participate further in the tender process, they should complete and return the PQQ clearly identifying which Lot that they are interested in tendering for (Category A: Principle Sub-Contractor - responsible for a full-service provision and emergency support service or, Category B: Miscellaneous Minor Works Sub-contractor). Completed PQQ require to be submitted by the date specified in the document.

The questionnaire shall require to be completed by the applicant and will be structured in such a way so as to facilitate the establishment of the suitability and capability of each applicant organization with regards to a specific Lot or Category.

Upon receipt, each response shall be quantifiably scored by the Contracting Authority. Those applicants which record the highest scores in each Category will be invited to proceed to the tender/ bidding stage.

The two categories shall eventually consist of a low number (one or more) principle sub-contractors ( Category A: Must have a minimum operative resource of 10 personnel), the other being several sub-contractors involved in miscellaneous minor works (Category B: No minimum resource level).

It would be envisaged that approximately 80 % of service requirements will be allocated to the Category A Sub-contractors, the remaining percentage of services being divided up amongst the Category B Sub-contractors.
Parties expressing an interest must state which Category of sub-contractor that they wish to apply for.
Parties may only select one Category. No more than the top six scoring applicants in each Category will be invited to proceed to the second stage of the process.
This tender/bidding stage may be followed by presentations and/or negotiations from which the most economically advantageous offer(s) will be established.
The proposed agreements will be for an initial 4 years term albeit an extension facility may increase this period up to a maximum of 8 years.
